battleship2000.programlogic.domain.position

Class Position

  • java.lang.Object
    • battleship2000.programlogic.domain.position.Position
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Comparable<Position>

    public class Position
extends Object
implements Comparable<Position>
    The Position class is used to store and retrieve the x- and y-coordinates of ship parts.
    Author:
    Petri Kallio

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Position(int x, int y)
      The Positions x- and y-coordinates are given as constructor parameters.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int compareTo(Position anotherPosition)
      By default, when two Positions are compared, the one that has the smaller y-coordinate value is prior to the other. If both compared Positions have the same y-coordinate value, the one with the smaller x-coordinate value is prior to the other. Otherwise, both of the compared values are equal.
      int getX() 
      int getY() 

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Position

        public Position(int x,
        int y)
        The Positions x- and y-coordinates are given as constructor parameters.
        Parameters:
        x - the x-coordinate
        y - the y-coordinate

    • Method Detail

      • getX

        public int getX()

      • getY

        public int getY()

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(Position anotherPosition)
        By default, when two Positions are compared,
        1. the one that has the smaller y-coordinate value is prior to the other.
        2. If both compared Positions have the same y-coordinate value, the one with the smaller x-coordinate value is prior to the other.
        3. Otherwise, both of the compared values are equal.
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface Comparable<Position>
        Parameters:
        anotherPosition - the Position that this is compared to
        Returns:
        -1 = prior, 0 = equal, 1 = posterior
